title: Pineapple Teriyaki Meatball Rice Bowls with Triple-Sauce Glaze

ingredients.name: Trader Joe's Pineapple Teriyaki Chicken Meatballs
mixed stir-fry vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas, carrots)

directions: Cook rice and have it ready and warm.

Heat meatballs in a skillet over medium heat with a splash of oil for 6-8 minutes until warmed through and lightly browned. Add 2 tbsp Bachan's Japanese Barbecue Sauce and toss until glazed and sticky.
In another pan (or same skillet once meatballs are done), heat 1 tsp sesame oil. Add vegetables and stir-fry 4-5 minutes. Add 1 tbsp Hoisin Sauce and a splash of soy sauce, toss until coated.
Assemble bowls: scoop rice into bowls, top with saucy vegetables and glazed meatballs.
Drizzle Sweet Chili Sauce over everything right before serving.
Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
notes: Sauce layering creates sweet, savory, tangy, and a bit of heat without clashing: Bachan's is the savory umami base for meatballs, Hoisin is the sweet rich sauce for veggies, Sweet Chili is the bright sweet-spicy finishing drizzle. Variations: use butter lettuce wraps instead of rice for lighter option, swap rice for lo mein or soba noodles, or make a quick extra glaze by whisking 2 tbsp soy sauce + 1 tbsp honey + 1 tsp rice vinegar.
